snippet: Some people enrolled in private coverage through the Affordable Care Act are hesitating to use their insurance because of the high out-of-pocket costs.
abstract: Many Americans enrolled in private coverage through Affordable Care Act are hesitating to use their new insurance because of high out-of-pocket costs; insurers are required to cover certain preventive services at no cost to consumer if provider is is in their network, but for other services and items, like prescription drugs, marketplace customers often have to meet their deductible before insurance starts to help.

byline.original: By ABBY GOODNOUGH and ROBERT PEAR

lead_paragraph: Some people enrolled in private coverage through the Affordable Care Act are hesitating to use their insurance because of the high out-of-pocket costs.

headline.main: Unable to Meet the Deductible or the Doctor
headline.print_headline: Unable to Meet the Deductible or the Doctor

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
